DataElement.preferredName: Biospecimen Preoperative Blood Collection And Tissue Bank Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An indication of whether the pre-operative/pre-anesthesia blood samples specified in the BPV Blood Collection and Processing SOP were collected from the participant and were successfully banked in the tissue bank.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Biospecimen Preoperative Blood Collection And Successful Tissue Bank
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._Relating to or occurring during the period immediately before a surgical operation._A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood._The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._An event that accomplishes its intended purpose._A repository of the tissue specimen, cells or cell lines, for experimental purpose. It can be from different diseases or different parts of the body.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Property.preferredName: Preoperative Blood Collection And Success Tissue Collection
Property.preferredDefinition: Relating to or occurring during the period immediately before a surgical operation.:A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.:The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.:An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.:An event that accomplishes its intended purpose.:A repository of the tissue specimen, cells or cell lines, for experimental purpose. It can be from different diseases or different parts of the body.

Concepts.definition: Relating to or occurring during the period immediately before a surgical operation.

A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.
The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
An event that accomplishes its intended purpose.
A repository of the tissue specimen, cells or cell lines, for experimental purpose. It can be from different diseases or different parts of the body.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Concepts linked to Tissue Banking and Pathology activities

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
